Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery transport amphora. Coarse, reddish yellow to brown (5 YR 6/6-4) clay with much silver mica and white and dark grey inclusions. White slip; exterior, glaze fired red-brown; vertical line to left and broad horizontal band with looping line below it.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski's photograph has the sherd turned 90 degrees.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 23, no. A12, pl. 3, 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.001)
